snippet: Gas prices fell 7.4 percent, the most in nearly four years, offsetting a small rise in food and pushing the overall index lower.
abstract: Labor Department says the consumer price index dropped 0.3 percent for November from October; gas prices fell 7.4 percent, biggest drop in nearly four years, offsetting a 0.2 percent rise in food prices.
lead_paragraph: Gas prices fell 7.4 percent, the most in nearly four years, offsetting a small rise in food and pushing the overall index lower.

headline.main: Consumer Prices Fall 0.3% on Lower Gas Costs
headline.print_headline: Consumer Prices Fall 0.3% on Lower Gas Costs
